page.title: 02General Survey continued.
page.content: Of the latter slightly over half are not country bred. There is an almost even division between those working locally and those who travel to work for distances varying from between 5 and 12 miles. Local occupations listed in addition to farming,shop_keeping & garage work included teaching,nursing,vetinary work,ownership of a public/guest house ,engineering,social work physiotherapy ,insurance and parcel delivery. 29 out of the 33 own the properties in which they live. 13 have lived in their present home for 20 years or more (one family for 300 years), while 16 have moved in within the last 10 years. According to a County Councillor there is a considerable turnover of households as folk 'try' country life,find difficulties like the cost of travel and move away.
